p.secFol: B et amicus carni; C descendantes; D lacking; E sacramentum; F ponderis; G temptamenta; H fons mittit

physDesc.p: The volume comprises seven discrete parts, B—H, preceded and followed by medieval flyleaves. Of the seven parts, C and F are each made up of two sections. It can be shown that B—C and F are interlinked but D and E may or may not belong with them. G and H are both single units probably not originally connected.

The interconnections can be proved as follows. B and C share the same green initials with red infilling and red initials with blue infilling. B and F share the same 12th-century nota marks. C and D are linked by the use of a distinctive form of punctus flexus. C and F share the same large red initials flourished blue, and a series of quire numbers of which XIIus and XIIIus remain intact on quires 10 and 11 but only us remains on quires 3, 8, and 9. Therefore B—F belong together, except that E, which has no necessary connection with the other items, may or may not belong. In favour of a connection between B and F and E are (i) the weight of probability when so many other parts are interconnected, (ii) the fact that E is written on very similar parchment to the rest of B—C and F (except the inserted half-sheet fol. 54) in the same variety of hands as C, and (iii) the fact that all are of about the same date.

supportDesc.support: Fore- and endleaves: fol. inventory; fol. ir, blank; fol. iv, number; fol. iir, contents-lists; fols. Ir-IIv, blank.
supportDesc.foliation: Leaves are numbered in post-medieval ink.
supportDesc.collation:
The collation and the relationship between text, leaves, and quires are as follows:
*A: fols. i-ii, flyleaves, not in collation (fols. i and ii each conjunct with the double pastedown)
B: fols. 1-8, quire 18; fols. 9-17, quire 28 (+1 leaf inserted after 7 (= fol. 16))
C(i—ii): fols. 18-41, quires 3-58
D: fols. 42-5, quire 64
E: fols. 46—54, quire 78 (+1 half-sheet inserted after 8 (= fol. 54))
F(i-ii): fols. 55-84, quires 8-108 116
G: fols. 85-109, quires 1212 1312 (+1 leaf after 12 (= fol. 109))
H: fols.110-59, quires 14-178182
fols. I-II, flyleaves, not in collation: a bifolium
pastedown: unnumbered, not in collation: conjugate with stub between fols. 157 and 158

binding.p: Sewn on five bands between cushion-bevelled projecting oak boards covered with alum-tawed sheepskin. The pattern of the lacing-in holes, visible under the back pastedown, is style 6 in Pollard, 'Medieval Bookbindings'. The spine has been replaced, and parts of the edges restored, in modern leather: Repaired by Maltby, May 1951 inside the front cover. On the front cover are the remains of two straps and on the back cover are two catches for them. Also on the back cover, near the top, inside and outside, are marks of a chain-staple held by two nails (position 7). At the bottom of the back cover, inside and outside, are six holes for a chain-plate (position 1), the outline of which is visible on the outside of the cover. At the bottom of the back cover are holes from yet another chain-staple, smaller and more like that at the top of the cover (position 5). Edges are yellowed and there is a fore-edge title. On the remains of the old spine, stuck inside the front cover, is a black leather lozenge-shaped label with 3 on it.

history.provenance:
Although only part F is included by C. H. Talbot in his list of Cistercian manuscripts in Great Britain, Traditio, 8 (1952), 402-18, the use of the punctus flexus in C and D tends to point to a Cistercian origin for them and it is tempting to read a local significance into the appearance of the name W. de Wenrich (Windrush) in H and to suggest that the whole manuscript had a connection with west Oxfordshire and conceivably with the Cistercian abbey at Bruern, one of the few houses of that order in Oxfordshire and only a few miles from Windrush. The inventory written on fol. ir it may suggest that the book was in personal rather than institutional ownership in the early 15th century. Ker, All Souls, records the book in a list (List II, no. 75, with libri theologie cathenati) made in the lifetime of the Founder. On fol. 2r, in a bâtarde hand, is an ex libris style 7, Liber collegii omnium fidelium defunctorum Oxon' datus per Henricum Penwortham. It is a survivor of the books which Penwortham (d. 1438), Chichele's registrar and treasurer, bequeathed to the archbishop for his new foundation: on him see BRUO. On fol. ir is an ex libris style 2, Liber Collegii Omnium Animarum Fidelium Defunctorum de Oxon. No. 25 in James, Ecloga, and no. 1406 (5) in CMA.
All Souls library identifications, on which see Introduction, are, inside the front cover, v.v.3.9, w.w.5.3 (both deleted), 100 (in pencil), MS 19 (figure added), bookplate no. 10 with L.R. 1.d.12 written on it, and <P...>. At the top right-hand corner of fol. iir is 6 : 10 in pencil and on fol. iiv 25.

recordHist.source: Andrew G. Watson, A Descriptive Catalogue of the Medieval Manuscripts of All Souls College Oxford (Oxford, 1997)

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact library@all-souls.ox.ac.uk.

altIdentifier.idno: All Souls College MS. 19, part A*

msItem.incipit: Fol. ir. Tanry[..] us(?) [Taury (?)] | Bona Ventura. liber de nat[ur] a gemmarum. liber de Symone magno [sic]. liber super totam bibliam. liber trentale Rubeus. liber de fisica. Niger liber de papiro. liber vrinarum. liber de comput' librorum. quinque quaterne sermonum. liber Rectorum, a nax and a ponder box and .iij. candylstyks of laton and a bow. and my gret tabyllys and a good brydyll and a goud bylle and j good pyked staffe at bothe ye endys and a lyght staff wythe a wharrel hede thereon and j good axe.

handDesc.handNote: In an anglicana hand of s. xvin, using single-compartment a.

altIdentifier.idno: All Souls College MS. 19, part B

msItem.rubric: Fol. 1r. Incipit omelia prima Eusebii emiseni de pascha.
msItem.incipit: Exulta celum et letare terra. Dies iste [altered from ista] amplius de celo radiauit
msItem.explicit: Fol. 17r. Memento mei domine. cum ueneris in regnum tuum.
msItem.author: Eusebius 'Gallicanus' (Ps.-Eusebius Emesenus)
msItem.title: Homiliae xii, xiv-xxiii (De pascha 1, 3-12),
xxiv (De latrone beato)

listBibl.bibl: Recorded as Ps.-Jerome by B. Lambert, Bibliotheca Hieronymiana manuscripta, 4 vols. (Steenbrugge, 1969-72), 3A, nos. 324, 338, q.v. for other manuscripts.

msItem.note: Fol. 17v is blank and rather dirty, as though it had been the final page in an unbound booklet.

supportDesc.support: Quires 1-2 of the whole volume. Membrane of rather inferior quality.
supportDesc.collation: No quire numbers, quire signatures, or catchwords.

layoutDesc.layout:
One column,
213 135-40 34 lines. Pricked in inner and outer margins. Drypoint ruling. Folded HSOS.

handDesc.handNote: Script is protogothic bookhand by at least six scribes some of whom tend to introduce documentary features into letter-forms. Punctuation is by low point, punctus elevatus, and punctus versus.

decoDesc.decoNote: Red or green initials of which only one is flourished.

altIdentifier.idno: All Souls College MS. 19, part C

msItem.rubric: Fol. 18r. Inicipit prefatio sophronij. Eusebii Ieronimi presbiteri in expositione Beati marci ewangeliste.
msItem.incipit: Omnis scriba doctus in regno celorum similis est huiusmodi patrifamilias
msItem.explicit: Fol. 31r. signa credencium cum matheo et luca concordans enarrat.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit expositio sancti Ieronimi presbiteui super Marcum.
msItem.author: Ps.-Jerome
msItem.title: Commentarius in evangelium secundum Marcum

listBibl.bibl: Lambert, Bibliotheca Hieronymiana manuscripta, as above, no. 473, lists other manuscripts;

msItem.rubric: Fol. 31v. Incipit tractatus Magistri Hugonis super ecclesiasten secundum librum salomonis.
msItem.incipit: Que de libro salomonis qui eclesiastes [sic] dicitur
Verba ecclesiastis [sic] filij david regis ierusalem
msItem.explicit: Fol. 41v. quod faciendum est. quia et ipsum cum factum ||
msItem.author: Hugo de S. Victore
msItem.title: In Salomonis ecclesiasten homiliae XIX

supportDesc.support: Quires 3-5 of the whole volume. Membrane of good average quality. Punctuation by medial point, low point, punctus elevatus, punctus flexus, and punctus interrogativus.
supportDesc.collation: Trace of one quire number on fol. 25v: on the significance of this see Structure above. No catchwords.

layoutDesc.layout:
One column,
232 150 37-44 lines. Pricked in outer margins. Drypoint ruling. Folded HSOS.

handDesc.handNote: Written in a large number of protogothic hands, of which some, e.g. on fols. 18v-19r, 34v-40r, verge on the documentary.

decoDesc.decoNote: Red initials, and green initials of which only one is flourished, in red.

altIdentifier.idno: All Souls College MS. 19, part D

msItem.explicit: Fol. 45r. cum hoc modo omnium una conuincatur
msItem.author: Gilbert of Hoyland, O. Cist.
msItem.title: Sermones in Cantica
msItem.note:
Before the first word of the text, [re] uelationis, a 13th-century hand wrote hic non incipit and below the abrupt ending on fol. 45r another wrote in hardpoint Quer' reliq' in libro alio(?). Our text begins in Sermo VII. 1 (PL 184. 43 A 3) and ends in Sermo VIII. 5 (ibid. 50 C 7). On Gilbert see J. Vuong-Dinh-Lam, in Dict. de spiritualité, vi, cols. 371-4; also references in Schneyer (Autoren: E—H), 186.
Fol. 45v is blank.

supportDesc.support: Quire 6 of the whole volume. Membrane of average quality.
supportDesc.collation: No quire numbers, quire signatures, or catchwords.

layoutDesc.layout:
Two columns, each
215 60-5 32 lines. Pricked in inner and outer margins. Drypoint ruling. Folded HSOS.

handDesc.handNote: Written in a good protogothic bookhand. Punctuation by low point, punctus elevatus, punctus flexus, and punctus interrogativus.

altIdentifier.idno: All Souls College MS. 19, part E

msItem.rubric: Fol. 46r. Sermo beati leonis pape. in passione domini.
msItem.incipit: Desiderata nobis dilectissimi et uniuerso optabilis mundo. adest festiuitas dominice passionis
msItem.explicit: Fol. 54r. Qua sentencia nimis trepidus ac segnis ostenditur. Qui nulla persecutione pulsatur.
msItem.author: Leo I
msItem.title: Sermones de passione domini

listBibl.bibl: Pr. PL 54. 349-84, this text ending col. 383 B 15; CPL 1657.

Chavasse prints the sermons in the order 62, 60, 63, 65, 61, 59, 70, ending p. 431/122; in our text lines 123-67 are lacking, although three lines remain unused on the recto of the inserted half-sheet, fol. 54, and its verso is blank.

supportDesc.support: Quire 7 of the whole volume. Membrane of average quality.
supportDesc.collation: No quire numbers, quire signatures, or catchwords.

layoutDesc.layout:
One column,
225-30 140 30-4 lines. Pricked in inner and outer margins. Drypoint ruling. Folding may be FSOS but cer¬tainty is impossible since flesh and hair sides are very similar.

handDesc.handNote: Perhaps in only one very variable protogothic bookhand, even from fol. 52r/5, where the script turns into a documentary script. With much alternation between it and bookhand forms this continues to the end. Documentary forms are most pronounced on fol. 52rv, where there is a rapid alternation between bookhand and documentary forms. Punctuation by low point and punctus elevatus

decoDesc.decoNote: Plain red and plain blue initials.
Small capitals in text are stroked with red. Rubrics.

altIdentifier.idno: All Souls College MS. 19, part F

msItem.rubric: Fol. 55r. Incipit prologus doinni [sic] Arnaldi abbatis boneuallis in librum de cardinalibus christi operibus. quem scripsit ad Adrianum papam.
msItem.incipit: Sullimes [sic] materie. subtilium ingeniorum exigunt tractatores. nec facile de artibus recte iudicat
msItem.explicit: Fol. 57r. et recordationem nostri supplex mereatur affectus.
msItem.rubric: Incipit sermo de natali domini nostri Ihesu. christi.
msItem.incipit: Adest christi multum desiderata. et diu exspectata natiuitas
msItem.finalRubric: Fol. 78v. Semo [sic] de sancto spiritu In pentecoste
msItem.explicit: Adesto sancte spiritus et paraclisim [sic] tuam expectantibus illabere celitus
Fol. 80v. cognoscibilis deus. et inhabitator spiritus sanctus.
msItem.author: Arnoldus of Bonnevalle
msItem.title: Liber de cardinalibus operibus Christi

msItem.rubric: Fol. 81. Incipit prologus Sancti Augustini episcopi de assumptione beate marie.
msItem.incipit: Ad interrogata de uirginis et matris domini resolutione temporali... imperium in omnia secula seculorum amen.
msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus Sancti Augustini episcopi de assumptione beate marie.
msItem.explicit: Fol. 83v. Sin autem ut non debui. ignosce to et tui qui cum deo patre et spiritu uiuit et regnat deus. per omnia secula seculorum amen
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractatus Sancti Augustini episcopi de assumptione beate marie matris domini.
msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine

listBibl.bibl: F. Romer, Die handschriftliche Überlieferung der Werke des heiligen Augustinus, ii: Grossbritannien and Inland, 2 vols. (Sitzungsberichte der Österreichischen Akademie der Wissenschaften, Phil.-Hist. Klasse, 276, 281; Vienna, 1972), i. 32, ii. 287.
For consideration of the authorship see H. Barre, Études mariales, 7 (1949), 80-100.

msItem.note: Fol. 84rv is blank except for a quire number on the verso.

supportDesc.support: Quires 8-11 of the whole volume. Membrane of average quality.
supportDesc.collation: For quire numbers see Structure above.

layoutDesc.layout:
One column,
235 160 307 lines. Only prickings for vertical ruling are visible, others having been trimmed off; there were probably none in inner margins. Drypoint rul¬ing. HSOS.

handDesc.handNote: Written in several protogothic bookhands. Punctua¬tion by low point, punctus elevatus, and punctus interrogativus.

decoDesc.decoNote: Red initials, some plain, some flourished blue or green.

altIdentifier.idno: All Souls College MS. 19, part G

msItem.incipit: Fol. 85r. Dominus dicit in euangelio. Beati misericordes qui ipsi
msItem.explicit: Fol. 109v. homo nutritur ac pascitur. Explicit liber scintille scripturarum.
msItem.author: Defensor of Ligugé
msItem.title: Liber scintillarum

listBibl.bibl: Rochais, Sacris Erudiri, 9 (1957), 199-264, describes 360 manuscripts (of which this is no. 196) and twenty-four editions: addenda in Revue Mabillon, nos. 291-2 (1983), 267-93.
On the work see Rochais, Revue benedictine, 63(1953), 246-91.

msItem.note: Rochais, Sacris Erudiri, states correctly that this manuscript includes chs. 44, 13, 2, 4, 62, 41, 31, 52, 55, 66, 79, 1, 3, 5, 36, 39, 19-21, 23-5, 27-30, 33-4, 38, 42, 47, 49-81, but that covers only as far as fol. 96v. Fols. 97r—109v(quire 13) are a separate manuscript, presumably added to complete the series. The textual join is not quite perfect: fol. 96v ends opera in with the catchword digentibus while fol. 97r begins indigentibus, but thereafter chs. 50-81 follow, completing the text and duplicating chs. 55, 62, and 66 in the first part. At the bottom of fol. 85r a hand of s. xivin wrote Liber scintillarum in drypoint.

supportDesc.support: Quires 12-13 of the whole volume. Membrane of average quality.

layoutDesc.layout:
Two columns, each
210 65-75 45 lines. Only prickings for vertical ruling are visible. Fols. 85-96 ruled in crayon, the rest in pencil. Folded HSOS.

handDesc.handNote: Fols. 85r-96v and 97r-109v are written in different gothic rotunda bookhands. Punctuation in both parts is by low point and punctus elevatus.

decoDesc.decoNote: Blue lombards flourished red at beginning of text, plain red or blue initials elsewhere.
Rubrics in part 2. Red and blue paragraph marks throughout the text in part 1, blue only, before rubrics, in part 2.

altIdentifier.idno: All Souls College MS. 19, part H

msItem.rubric: Fol. 110r. Incipit tabula exemplorum de habundancia adopcionum ad onznenz materiam in sermoizibus secundum ordinem alphabeti ordinata. Accidia.
msItem.incipit: Accidia. Nota accidiosus est sicut canis
msItem.author: John Waleys
msItem.title: Tabula exemplorum

listBibl.bibl: Ed. J. Th. Welter, La Tabula exemplorum secundum ordinem alphabeti... Thèse complémentaire présentée à la Faculté des lettres de l'Université de Paris (Paris, Toulouse, 1926) (this manuscript p. xxii);
On the author see J. Swanson, John Waleys (Cambridge, 1989), to whom this manuscript was not known; also Stegmüller, Bibl. iii. 338 and BRUO, #Waleys'.

msItem.note: On fol. 159v is 'L; [? Per] W de Wenrich [Windrush] precia iij sol. in crayon, in a hand of s. xivin and, in hardpoint, s. xiv, Sunt hec collecta libro uulgalia [sic] multa | Ex alphabeto distincte scripta teneto | Et positum titulo quodlibet ex propria, Walther, Initia, 18825 (MSS Tours 460 fol. 1, and Avignon 308 fol. 269, with slight differ¬ences; etc.).

supportDesc.support: Quires 14-18 of the whole volume. Written on average-quality membrane with blemishes.

collation.signatures: There is the remains of a series of quire signatures on fols. 134-9 and 146-52 consisting of little red horizontal strokes at the right-hand bottoms of pages, running to the sixth leaf of the quire.
collation.catchwords: Catchwords in the scribe's hand on fols. 145v and 157v.

layoutDesc.layout:
Two columns, each
210 70 45 lines. Only prickings for vertical rulings are visible. Ruling in crayon. Folded HSOS.

handDesc.handNote: The script is gothic rotunda bookhand. Punctuation by low point.

decoDesc.decoNote: Blue lombards flourished red, red and blue paragraph marks, rubrics.
